definition: as if one had lost something (idiom)/to look or feel unsettled or distracted/to feel empty
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I get a notion from the look in your eyes, yea.
sentences.chinese: 从你的眼睛里我能看到你若有所失的影踪。

sentences.english: Yet now that the last day was at hand, suddenly Bran felt lost.
sentences.chinese: 可现在离出发只剩一天，布兰却突然若有所失起来。

sentences.english: But I feel that something is missing.
I wandered around our house all alone but didn't feel lost as I had before.
sentences.chinese: 我独自在房子里四下走动，却不像之前那样若有所失。

sentences.english: My intuition told that we belong to each other, or I will not always feel as if something were missing.
sentences.chinese: 直觉我们应属于彼此，否则我不会常常若有所失。

sentences.english: But not having a dad left a big hole in my life.
sentences.chinese: 但是没有爸爸这一点还是令我的生活若有所失。

definition: lit. to be frustrated as though having lost sth (idiom)/fig. to be at a loss/perplexed/frustrated
anxious and perplexed/uneasy and confused/suspicious and fearful
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
see 恍如隔世[huang3 ru2 ge2 shi4]
